Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish and label the different parts of the fish (e.g., fins, tail, body).
The student can draw the water environment where the fish lives, such as a pond, lake, river, or ocean.
The student can label the habitat and explain that fish need water to swim and survive.
The student can draw and label other living things in the water environment (e.g., plants, other fish).
The student can show and label resources that fish and other living things need, like water and plants.
The student can connect and label how the water environment provides everything the fish needs to live.
